subject: Re: Why must test methods return void?
msgSnippet: ... Been there, done that :) Years ago I asked *exactly* the same question on this list, and eventually wrote an extension of JUnit that allows tests to
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "dmcg123" <duncan@...> wrote:
> After over 10 years of using JUnit, it has only just struck me that test methods must return void, but why?
> I've just come across an example where a particular test did a lot of work, and I wanted to piggy-back on its final state by calling the method from another test.

Been there, done that :)

Years ago I asked *exactly* the same question on this list, and eventually wrote an extension of JUnit that allows tests to piggy-back on the result of other tests. See http://scg.unibe.ch/jexample

cheers,
AA
